intro: Phlegmariurus kuesteri, commonly known as the Kuester's clubmoss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a creeping, mat-forming growth habit with small, scale-like leaves arranged in whorls around its stems. Its reproductive structures, known as archegonia, are located on the lower surface of the leaves, facilitating sexual reproduction. This liverwort plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
